Not all mammals are terrestrial; whales and dolphins live in the ocean.
The moon doesn't turn blue; a "blue moon" refers to the second full moon in a calendar month.

distractors: Not all ice is cold; under extreme pressure, ice can exist at higher temperatures.

golds: You can't light a match on Saturn; the planet lacks oxygen, which is necessary for combustion.
Not all animals have hearts; some simple organisms, like sponges, lack this organ.
Coffee doesn't stunt your growth; this is a myth with no scientific evidence to support it.
Not all plants are green; some have red, purple, or even black leaves due to different pigments.
Humans can't digest cellulose; it passes through the digestive system largely unchanged.
Not all sharks are large and menacing; some species, like the dwarf lanternshark, are small and harmless.
You can't cure a cold with antibiotics; colds are caused by viruses, and antibiotics target bacteria.
Not all deserts are lifeless; they host a variety of plants and animals adapted to arid conditions.
Polar bears don't live in Antarctica; they are native to the Arctic region.
Not all currency is physical; digital currencies like Bitcoin exist solely in electronic form.
The sun doesn't rise exactly in the east everywhere on Earth; its exact point of sunrise shifts with the seasons.
Not all glass is transparent; some types, like frosted glass, are designed to be translucent or opaque.
You can't survive indefinitely without sleep; lack of sleep can lead to serious health issues.
Not all dinosaurs were large; some species were the size of chickens or smaller.
Wi-Fi doesn't cause cancer; there's no scientific evidence linking Wi-Fi exposure to cancer.
Not all rivers flow into the ocean; some end in lakes or evaporate in deserts.
Humans don't use only 10% of their brains; this is a myth, as we use most of our brain throughout the day.
Not all moons are dry and barren; Jupiter's moon Europa is believed to have a subsurface ocean.
